title.narrative: HEALTH OP 1 HSS

description.narrative: By 2023, MNCAH platform is strengthened in targeted areas as a contribution to improving high impact interventions for pregnant women, newborn, children, and adolescents., which contributes to Health And Development In Early Childhood And Adolescence, Immunization Services As Part Of Primary Health Care, Mental Health And Psychosocial Well-Being, Nutrition Of Adolescents And Women, Strengthening Primary Health Care And High-Impact Health Interventions. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Community Engagement, Social And Behaviour Change, Data, Research, Evaluation And Knowledge Management, Developing And Leveraging Resources And Partnerships, Evaluations, Research And Data, Fostering Innovation And Use Of New Technologies, Innovation, Operational Support To Programme Delivery, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building, Systems Strengthening To Leave No One Behind. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: 1.12 - Appui sur le financment de la Sante et CSU

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: By 2023, MNCAH platform is strengthened in targeted areas as a contribution to improving high impact interventions for pregnantwomen, newborn, children, and adolescents.

description.narrative: UNICEF&39;s work on Health Systems Strengthening in 2021 focused on Finalizing the national health financing strategic plan, reforming the national Community health system including the development of a community health investment case, strengthening the performance of the national Health Information System, and preparing the groundwork for the revision of the national Human resource development plan. UNICEF supported the update of the package of interventions in the National Community Health strategy, the National Adolescent Health Policy and the development of an advocacy note for reducing financial barriers to access health care towards the achievement of the 2030 Universal Health Care goal. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:10/01/2022
